page.title: 12ST.JAMES MILL ROAD-INDUSTRY
page.content: St.James Mill Road was as its name suggests originally a track to a mill on the River Nene.From the 1920s this flood plain area was used as a dumping place for the town's rubbish.After the 2nd World War the dumping of refuse went on and the flood plain was reclaim ed from the River,a road and factories were built on top oompressed refuse. Today 41 companies have buildings on the site including the original refuse depot,now known as the Westbridge Depot There is a great variety of interests represented amongst which we have a Booksellers,an Oil Terminal,a Buiiders' Merchants,a Plastics Firm,a Computer Company,a Furniture Warehouse,a Home - care Centre,a Soft Drinks Firm,and sev- eral firms involved in the Motor Trade crash repairs,body builders,components suppliers,as well as a number of engin- eering firms and an air cargo Terminal.
